description.narrative: The proposed Project development objective (PDO) is to improve urban mobility in the city of Quito serving the growing demand for public transport. The Project will reduce travel times, decrease operational costs of the transport service, improve connectivity, security and comfort of the current system and reduce emissions of pollutants and greenhouse gases.

participating-org.narrative: Empresa Publica Metropolitana de Metro de Quito
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Municipio del Distrito Metropolitano de Quito

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements | Description :Schedule 2. Section I. A. The Borrower shall cause the EPMMQ tomaintain, throughout the implementation of the Project, key staff for the Project including without limitation, a Projectcoordinator, a procurement specialist, a financial management specialist, an environmental specialist, a social specialist, aphysical cultural resources specialist and a health and safety specialist. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Operational Manual | Description :Schedule 2. Section I. B. The Borrower shall, and shall cause the EPMMQ to,carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions of the ROP, which sets forth the rules and procedures for the carrying outof the Project | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E. 3 | Description :The Borrower shall cause the EPMMQ to establish and maintainthroughout Project implementation an adequate institutional capacity, including staffing, and systems acceptable to the Bank, asshall be necessary to fully implement, manage, coordinate, and monitor the implementation of the Safeguard Instruments.

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.1 | Description :The Borrower shall, and shall cause EPMMQ to, ensure that the Projectis carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental Impact Assessment (including the EMP), the PGASS-H (includingthe PAC and the PAC Health and Safety), the RPF, the RAPs, the IPPF and any applicable IPPs. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.2(a) | Description :The Borrower shall, and shall cause EPMMQ to, ensure that: (a) foreach activity which involves works under the Project for which the RPF provides for the preparation of a RAP, (i) prior to thecarry out of any said works, such RAP is prepared and disclosed in accordance with the RPF, adequately consulted with AffectedPersons as per the RPF, and furnished to the Bank for review and approval;... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.2(b) | Description :2. Without limitation to paragraph 1 above, the Borrower shall, andshall cause EPMMQ to, ensure that: (...)(b) for each activity under the Project for which the IPPF provides for the preparationofan IPP: (i) prior to the carryout out of any said activity, such IPP is prepared in accordance with the IPPF, adequatelyconsulted upon and furnished to the Bank for review and approval; (ii) the... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.4 | Description :1. Without limitation to the provisions of this Section, the Borrowershall, and shall cause EPMMQ to: (a) maintain and publicize the availability of the grievance redress mechanism set forth in thePGASS-H for purposes of listening to complaints raised in relation with the implementation of the Project; and (b) thereafter takeall measures necessary to implement the decisions made by the Borro... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.5 | Description :The Borrower shall ensure, and cause EPMMQ to ensure, that allcontractors and subcontractors (which contracts were awarded pursuant to the terms of this Agreement): (i) comply with theobligations under the applicable Safeguard Instruments; and (ii) comply with the Code of Conduct that should be provided to andsigned by all workers; all in a manner satisfactory to the Bank and as applicable t... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.6 | Description :The Borrower shall ensure, and cause EPMMQ to ensure, that all biddingdocuments and contracts for civil works to be awarded pursuant to the terms of this Agreement shall include the obligation of therelevant contractors and subcontractors to: (i) comply with the obligations under the applicable Safeguard Instruments; and (ii)adopt and enforce code of conducts that should be provided to an... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. E.7 | Description :The Borrower shall provide, and/or cause to be provided, all the fundsnecessary or appropriate to perform its obligations under the Project, including, as applicable, all the funds required toimplementthe pertinent RAPs, in a manner satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section III. 1 | Description :The Borrower shall, and shall cause EPMMQ to, ensure that all goods,works and services required for the Project, and to be financed out of the proceeds of the Loan are procured under proceduresconsistent with the Bankâ€™s Core Procurement Principles set forth in the Procurement Regulations. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. B.1 | Description :The Borrower shall, and shall cause the EPMMQ to: (a) update the ROPto include the arrangements for the process and procedures for control, approve and monitor cash and in-kind compensations forResettlement Expenditures, under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank; and (b) immediately thereafter carry out theProject in accordance with the provisions of the ROP. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 1 | Description :The Borrower shall, and shall cause EPMMQ to, ensure that the Projectis carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental Impact Assessment (including the EMP), the PGASS-H (includingthe PAC and the PAC Health and Safety), the RPF, the RAPs, the IPPF and any applicable IPPs. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 2 (a) | Description :For each activity which involves works under the Project forwhich the RPF provides for the preparation of a RAP, (i) prior to the carry out of any said works, such RAP is prepared anddisclosed in accordance with the RPF, adequately consulted with Affected Persons as per the RPF, and furnished to the Bank forreview and approval; and (ii) thereafter the RAP is adopted and implemented in accord... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 2 (b) | Description :For each activity under the Project for which the IPPF providesfor the preparation of an IPP: (i) prior to the carry out of any said activity, such IPP is prepared and disclosed in accordancewith the IPPF, adequately consulted upon and furnished to the Bank for review and approval; and (ii) thereafter the IPP is adoptedand implemented in accordance with its terms and in a manner satisfactory... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 3 | Description :The Borrower shall cause the EPMMQ to establish and maintainthroughout Project implementation an adequate institutional capacity, including staffing, and systems acceptable to the Bank, asshall be necessary to fully implement, manage, coordinate, and monitor the implementation of the Safeguard Instruments. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 4 | Description :thThe Borrower shall, and shall cause EPMMQ to: (a) maintain andpublicize the availability of the grievance redress mechanism set forth in the PGASS-H for purposes of listening to complaintsraised in relation with the implementation of the Project; and (b) thereafter take all measures necessary to implement thedecisions made by the Borrower and EPMMQ under such grievance redress mechanism, a... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 5 | Description :The Borrower shall ensure, and cause EPMMQ to ensure, that allcontractors and subcontractors (which contracts were awarded pursuant to the terms of Original Loan Agreement): (i) comply with theobligations under the applicable Safeguard Instruments; and (ii) comply with the Code of Conduct that should be provided to andsigned by all workers; all in a manner satisfactory to the Bank and as app... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 6 (i) | Description :The Borrower shall ensure, and cause EPMMQ to ensure, that allbidding documents and contracts for civil works to be awarded pursuant to the terms of this Agreement shall include the obligationof the relevant contractors and subcontractors to: (i) comply with the obligations under the applicable Safeguard Instruments. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 6 (ii) | Description :The Borrower shall ensure, and cause EPMMQ to ensure, that allbidding documents and contracts for civil works to be awarded pursuant to the terms of this Agreement shall include the obligationof the relevant contractors and subcontractors to: ii) adopt and enforce code of conducts that should be provided to and signed byall workers. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 7 | Description :The Borrower shall provide, and/or cause to be provided, all thefunds necessary or appropriate to perform its obligations under the Project, including, as applicable, all the funds required toimplement the pertinent RAPs, in a manner satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 8 (a) | Description :For purposes of carrying out a land acquisition review of theproperties identified in the PAC, the Borrower shall: (a) cause EPMMQ to not later than forty-five (45) business days after theEffective Date, prepare and furnish to the Bank, a time-bound action plan, acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. D. 8 (b) | Description :The Borrower shall implement, and cause EPMMQ to implement (asthe case may be), said time-bound action plan (including any corrective action, as determined and approved by the Bank), all inaccordance with its terms and in a manner acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 | Description :The Borrower shall cause the EPMMQ to maintain, throughout theimplementation of the Project, key staff for the Project, including without limitation, a Project coordinator, a procurementspecialist, a financial management specialist, an environmental specialist, a social specialist, a physical cultural resourcesspecialist and a health and safety specialist, all with terms of reference, and quali | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II | Description :The Borrower shall cause EPMMQ to furnish to the Bank each Project Reportnot later than forty-five days after the end of each calendar semester, covering the calendar semester. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section III. 2 | Description :Goods, Works and Non-consulting Services. all goods, works andnon-consulting services required for Part II of the Project and to be financed out of the proceeds of the Loan shall be procured bythe Borrower: (a) in accordance with the provisions set forth in paragraphs 3.21, 3.23 (e), 3.24, 3.25, 3.32 of the ProcurementRegulations; and (b) otherwise also in accordance with the IADB Procuremen... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section III. 3 | Description :Goods, Works, Non-consulting Services and Consulting Services for PartV. All goods, works, and services required for Part V of the Project and to be financed out of the proceeds of the Loan shall beprocured in accordance with the requirements set forth or referred to in the Procurement Regulations and the provisions of theProcurement Plan | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Subsidiary Agreement | Description :Schedule 2. Section I. C. The Borrower shall enter into an agreement withthe EPMMQ, under terms and conditions satisfactory to theBank. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: GHG emissions from transport in DMQ
Operating costs of Quito's vehicle fleet
Percentage of metro feeder routes in operation
Percentage of technical and professional staff, directly empoyed by the operator of PLMQ, that is female
Percentage of bus fleet under unified fare-collection system
Percentage of users satisfied with overall metro service, its security and comfort (differentiated by gender and income)
Percentage of physical work progress in rail yard
Percentage of progress in installation of permament way
Percentage of progress in installation of power supply, auxiliary, signaling and telecom systems
Percentage of physical work progress in stations and universal access
Percentage of physical work progress in civil works other than stations
Travel time for public transportation users
Percentage of jobs accessible in 60 minutes of travel time
Adequate passenger capacity provided by PLMQ
Implementation of a reporting mechanism for cases of violence against women and girls in the PLMQ
Percentage of female users satisfied with overall metro service, its security and comfort
Percentage of low-income users satisfied with overall metro service, its security and comfort
